text: request protocol to escort his
Excellency the assembly will hear an
address by his
Excellency G meso mendosa constitutional
president of the Republic of Ecuador I
request protocol to escort his
Excellency on behalf of the general
assembly I have the honor to welcome his
EXC Cy gilo lasso mendosa constitutional
president of the Republic of Ecuador and
to invite him to address the
assembly
Senor Mr tenis
Francis president of the 78th session of
the general
assembly distinguished delegates and
representatives of the nations of the
world we are here to renew our
commitment to the ideals and principles
that give life to the United
Nations Peace The Diplomatic resolution
of
conflicts and respect for freedoms and
human
rights in this brief address I shall
share our vision as efforts to address
the global challenges that we are
facing including climate
change chronic infant malnutrition and
even the most urgent threats to our
security since my government took
office we have rolled out an historic
policy of environmental
transition which preserves our natural
heritage
in parallel we have made great strides
in transitioning from unsustainable
production systems to a low emission
circular
economy in January
2022 we expanded the protection of the
galapagus:
this decision represents the greatest
step forward by my country towards the
preservation of our incomparable
biodiversity in addition we have
enhanced the Eastern tropical Pacific
Marine
Corridor acting in common purpose with
the Kindred nations of Colombia Costa
Rica and
Panama together we have created the
largest crossborder reserve in the world
in protecting
500,000 square kilometers home to
innumerable and unique species that use
these migratory
Roots we did this for our peoples and
for the
world above all my government has been
able to to balance environmental
aspirations with good economic
sense we have been pioneering in
implementing an
Innovative debt for conservation swap
initiative this redirects resources
towards the protection of the
galapagus: the debt swap amounted to
billion making it the largest transl
transaction of its kind in the history
of
humanity this figure is equivalent to
10% of Ecuador's public debt with
external private
creditors of this amount for 450 million
will be channeled into the
[Music]
galapagus: to Opportunities of various
kinds further we wish to express here
our concern at the upcoming and ever
more likely El Nino
phenomenon which could cause devastating
flooding in Ecuador and the
region to prepare for a potential event
on such a scale we have prioritized
prevention and we are working with the
United Nations to seek Alternative forms
of financing through multilateral
organizations we appeal to the
International
Community to consider risk mitigation
measures through the large Financial
funds and
non-reimbursable International
cooperation because the severity of this
event is related to climate
change this is a huge task that requires
the collaboration of all sectors of the
International
Community to achieve the sustainable
development
goals and to protect the future of us
all
however we are not only concerned by
environmental
issues we are also focusing on improving
the quality of life of the most
disadvantaged in
society particularly
children faced with alarming figures of
chronic infant
malnutrition
we have implemented the successful
Ecuador grows without child malnutrition
program through this program in just 28
months we reduced the rate of
malnutrition in infants under the age of
two by
3.5% shrinking it from
20.1% this type of malnutrition has
serious and irreversible consequences on
the children affected by it it affects
their neurological development their
ability to learn to
communicate to
think and to relate to
others so those children these children
from the beginning of their lives face
enormous disadvantages that have
negative repercussions on their
future in light of this painful reality
we have implemented this public policy
strategically to provide care to
pregnant women and to children in their
first 10,000 Days of life with medicines
and
vitamins
we have repurposed and equipped Health
Centers we've recruited more Family
Medicine Specialists more Obstetricians
and
nurses and we've further hired 50,000
Community
workers who go into neighborhoods to
detect cases of malnutrition in
time
thanks to this more than 20,000 children
under the age of two are now free of
chronic
malnutrition and all of this has
happened with investment of $650 million
over 28 months in
Government Solutions don't depend on how
much money a state has but rather how
much political will its leaders have
in our government with a lower average
oil price we've prioritized State
resources for this
cause because there's no growth nor
Economic Development if we do not invest
in social issues and in our
children we hope to be able to share our
experience with all of you and to join
forces so that in the near future we can
all together say the world is growing
without child
malnutrition
president Ecuador strives to promote
safe and responsible
migration we are one of the few
countries that is that experiences all
facets of migration we are a country of
origin of destination a Transit country
and a country of return and even of
Refuge migration in recent years has
been a challenge for the region because
it has meant facing complex situations
posing enormous challenges with cultural
economic and social
impacts Ecuador has hosted thousands of
migrants of different National
alties in light of this it was essential
to identify their needs their
circumstances activities and experiences
and this became a fundamental goal of
our Innovative
approach it led us to begin a
registration process for foreign
migrants residing in our
country irrespective of their migratory
status and we have now registered
citizens most of them are Venezuelan
citizens who reached Ecuador fleeing
hunger and
authoritarianism we want to give them a
better future guaranteeing all of their
rights giving them a humanitarian Visa
so that they they can regularize their
stay in our country and find it easier
to integrate into
society our arms have been open wide to
protect this population that is asking
for Refuge from us with or without
documents children are being enrolled in
schools everybody is treated in public
hospitals nonetheless the open doors
policy requires the valuable support of
the International
Community we have acted coherently and
in the spirit of
solidarity and we humbly hope that this
will be
reciprocated ladies and gentlemen after
31 years Ecuador has taken up the
challenge of returning to the security
Council
we've done this at a critical juncture
for
Humanity marked by extremely complex
phenomena such as the post pandemic
Global vulnerability and an unexpected
War which has heightened nuclear
tensions at the same time new problems
related to radicalization and violent
extremism are
emerging Ecuador has risen to the
challenge over the nine months of our
membership of the security Council we
have acted
consistently in accordance with the
United Nations
Charter we have prioritized the peaceful
resolution of conflicts and the
protection of
civilians the women peace and security
and women peace and security agenda as
well as combating illegal arms
trafficking our action is in response in
particular to new threats such as
transnational organized crime that
undermines Democratic stability Civic
safety and the rule of
law I reiterate my statement at the high
level meeting of the security Council on
Ukraine we call once again for a
cessation of the military aggression and
compliance with the order of the
international court of
justice and for progress towards a peace
based on the territorial Integrity of
Ukraine and the charter of the United
Nations we have warned that this
conflict not only inflicts pain and
destruction on the people of Ukraine but
also worsens Global Food insecurity and
destabilizes the global
economy
particularly in developing
countries for this reason we insist on
the resumption of the Black Sea grain
initiative all wars and conflicts must
cease excellencies I dedicate the rest
of my statement
to a topic which is of the utmost
concern to Ecuador and the
world I have been called upon to be the
head of a state at a momentous time in
history which like few others is under
violent Siege
by an enemy whose allies move between
the poorest borders that still divide
the legitimate from the illegal world
I'm referring to transnational organized
crime particularly drugs trafficking and
its dangerous and increasing effects on
public
life my government has beaten records in
the confiscation of drugs in Just 2
years we have seized more than 500 tons
this is a figure that far exceeds that
seized by previous
governments what we are seeing today is
the result of the blow that we have
wrought to the income of the
criminals such is the impact of our
policy last year the United Nations
recognized Ecuador as the third country
in the world in drug
seizures after the the United States and
Colombia just a few weeks ago Ecuador
experienced a hitherto unheard of
event the assassination of a
presidential
candidate I'm referring to Fernando
vieno a clear sighted and brave
Ecuadorian
who denounced outright the activity of
organized crime and its links with
political mafias transnational organized
crime is a corrupt and murderous system
which penetrates society and the state
which defies the Democratic stability of
our countries and which is progressing
at great
speed it's not a problem exclusive to
Ecuador it's a global
problem indeed across the world we see
expansion of the same phenomenon as
Ecuador is
suffering drugs traffi weapons
trafficking people smuggling forced
migration and illegal
mining if we do not fight together we
will continue to suffer them
alone if the enemy is able to multiply
itself states must also be able to
multiply our efforts even more
so it's vital for the future survival of
states that we Forge lasting robust and
effective mechanisms to bring an end to
criminal organizations and those who
support or sponsor
them because if we want to fully share
in the bounties of a globalized world we
must also face together
the very adversities that this brings
with
it
excellencies in this and in each and
every battle which we Face together you
can always count on Ecuador's unswerving
commitment thank you very
[Applause]
much on behalf of the assembly I wish to
thank the Constitutional president
of the Republic of Ecuador for the
statement just made and I request
protocol to escort his
Excellency the assembly will now hear an
address by his Excellency zoa Manuel
Gonzalez
Loreno the president of the Republic of
Angola I request protocol to escort his
Excellency
